message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a unique opportunity to acquire a high-value item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12000. Can you meet me halfway?

I understand you're interested in the product, but I was hoping to get a bit closer to the original price. I'm willing to meet you halfway from my original offer, so I can offer it to you for $13500. What do you think?
I'm still a bit hesitant about the price. I'd be willing to go up to $13000, but I think that's the highest I can go. Can you meet me at that price?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me at $13000, Bob, but I'm still a bit short of my target. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make sure I'm getting a good deal. I can offer it to you for $14000, which is a bit closer to my original price. What do you think?
I'm getting close to my limit, but I'm still not comfortable with $14000. I'd be willing to go up to $13500, but that's as high as I can go. Can you meet me at that price?

I appreciate your flexibility, Bob, but I'm still a bit far from my target. I'm willing to make one more compromise. I can offer it to you for $14250, which is the closest I can get to my original price. What do you think?

I'm really close to walking away, but I still want to try to make a deal. I'm willing to go up to $13750, and that's my final offer. If you can meet me at that price, I'll take the product. Otherwise, I'll have to look elsewhere.
